column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////I have been several times over the past year
column2: and each time seems very different. Each server seems to recommend different tapas as the house specialty. One thing is for sure
column4: was less than stellar and not worth the wait. Instead
column5: the calamari and garlic shrimp are worth a try. My favorite is the goat cheese warm in tomato base with toasted bread tips for dipping. The atmosphere is absolutely the redeeming quality for BaBa. It always has a great vibe; meeting friends there gives the impression you just joined in on a party. I keep going back because its usually the best late night dinner spot in the area
column6: and the atmosphere is perfect for a Chicago summer night.
